title: Confusing diagnostic: cycle detected when using placeholder on a function signature

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-verbose
labels.description: Too much output caused by a single piece of incorrect code

body:
I tried this code:

```rust
fn test(i: &i32) -> std::thread::JoinHandle<_> {
    std::thread::spawn(move || {
        let _ = i;
    })
}
```

[playground link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=020b7e353f174b6216e567318ffc2151)

I expected to see this happen:

```
error[E0121]: the type placeholder `_` is not allowed within types on item signatures
 --> src\lib.rs:1:44
  |
1 | fn test(i: &i32) -> std::thread::JoinHandle<_> {
  |                     ------------------------^-
  |                     |                       |
  |                     |                       not allowed in type signatures
  |                     help: replace with the correct return type: `JoinHandle<()>`
```

Instead, this happened:

```
error[E0391]: cycle detected when computing function signature of `test`
 --> src\lib.rs:1:1
  |
1 | fn test(i: &i32) -> std::thread::JoinHandle<_> {
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
note: ...which requires type-checking `test`...
 --> src\lib.rs:1:1
  |
1 | fn test(i: &i32) -> std::thread::JoinHandle<_> {
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  = note: ...which again requires computing function signature of `test`, completing the cycle
note: cycle used when collecting item types in top-level module
 --> src\lib.rs:1:1
  |
1 | fn test(i: &i32) -> std::thread::JoinHandle<_> {
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

Interestingly this seems to happen only when the closure captures a parameter (by value or by reference doesn't seem to make a difference) and that parameter contains a lifetime (even if elided).

Took from https://users.rust-lang.org/t/how-to-solve-cycle-detected/56170

`rustc --version --verbose`:
